attributes.comment:
The proposed increase of fees for immigration papers is appalling and unfair.
Every day immigrants are struggling to make ends meet, and now the US government
wants to make it harder for them to gain citizenship, bring over their loved
ones, and even get permission to work? This is unacceptable. It is
understandable to have occasional cost increases to meet the rise of inflation.
However, the proposed increase is too high. Making immigrants pay such higher
fees makes it that much harder for them to become financially independent and
stable members of our society. If the government is concerned about the cycle
of poverty, this is the wrong way to go about fixing the problem. Immigrants
need support-the support of their families, the support of a job with a living
wage, and the support of their new government. As one who helps immigrants go
through the process of obtaining work permits, green cards and citizenship I am
appalled at the action of USCIS. Many clients cannot even pay for the modest
service fee that is charged at my organization, and must also apply for fee
waivers when filing papers with USCIS. I sincerely hope that the government
will more closely examine the fee increases and only raise fees by the absolute
minimum possible and help as many immigrants as possible achieve instead of
raising fees and only allowing wealthy immigrants status. "Give me your tired,
your POOR, your hungry..."
